repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Songo Songo Gas Development and
            Power Generation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Songo Songo Gas
            Development and Power Generation Project for Tanzania were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible; Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the
            skill sets required for the power generation and gas
            components are different from the skill sets required to
            design and implement rural electrification. Project
            implementation planning must acknowledge different time
            frames needed for different types of project components.
            Social services and infrastructures for new sites where
            affected people are going to be relocated need to be in
            place before the process of relocation takes place. For
            innovative project implementation structures that have not
            been previously tested a market sounding before or during
            appraisal should be envisaged. Optimization of procurement
            strategies can lead significant project saving.

repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Songo Songo Gas Development and
            Power Generation Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The main development objective of the
            Songo Songo Gas Development and Power Generation Project is
            to develop Tanzania's natural gas reserves to produce
            least-cost power generation for domestic and industrial use
            in an environmentally sustainable and efficient manner.
            These restructurings were primarily approved to utilize
            savings of US$78 million that were achieved through
            competitive procurement under the main component of the
            project (part A) - the development of the gas infrastructure
            for power generation, which is owned and operated by Songas
            Ltd., a private sector entity. The first restructuring in
            May 2004 added a new component (part D- component herewith
            to be cancelled) to scale up the gas-fueled power generation
            capacity, and extended the project's closing date from
            March 31, 2006 to October 31, 2007. The Government of
            Tanzania (GoT), in their letter dated November 24, 2010,
            requested the International Development Association (IDA) to
            reallocate a total credit amount of Special Drawing Right
            (SDR) 1,258,192.97 across various categories and to cancel
            an amount of SDR 17,174,966.68 from the total credit amount
            of SDR 145.7 million (representing 12 percent of the total
            credit amount).

repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Songo Songo Gas Development
            Project - resettlement plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Project will develop indigenous
            natural gas from the Songo Songo reservoir, to displace the
            expensive, imported liquid fuel consumed for power
            generation, diminish the Government's role in the power
            sector through privatization of a thermal power plant, and,
            encourage increased access of the poor to electricity, by
            developing rural gas-to-electricity schemes. Nonetheless,
            preparation of the project conduced to the resettlement
            plan, implemented between May 1998 and May 2000, when both
            urban, and rural resettlement occurred along the pipeline
            route. Volume I specifies the resettlement plan, noting that
            in the absence of clear legal, and regulatory standards in
            Tanzania, the Bank's Operational Directive 4.30 should
            guide the process to minimize disruption, either through the
            way-of-leave program (WOLP) (cash compensations), or
            resettlement. The WOLP determined land values (including
            housing, structures, and crops) according to market value,
            with the provision of alternative plots of land, if
            allocation is less than half an acre, and, a Dispute
            Resolution Group was established to settle potential
            conflicts. The Resettlement process provided land-for-land
            compensation at replacement costs, including crop losses, to
            restore living standards of displaced populations. Volume II
            presents a resettlement impact assessment, followed by a
            socioeconomic assessment program, that reviews the process,
            and, includes the provision to restore infrastructure
            services in urban areas, to at least equivalent to the
            levels of services prior to resettlement, in light of lesser
            service levels experienced.  Volumes III, IV and V address
            resettlement issues concerning the subcomponent Wayleave
            Village electrification scheme.

repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Songo Songo Gas Development and
            Power Generation Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
This restructuring project paper extend
            the Songo Songo Gas Development and Power Generation Project
            closing date to December 31, 2009 and to use the savings
            under the Project for the following purposes: 1) to finance
            the decommissioning of wellhead for safety reasons; 2) to
            finance additional technical assistance to Tanzania Electric
            Supply Company Limited (TANESCO), to Ministry of Energy and
            Minerals (MEM), and to the Tanzania Petroleum Development
            Corporation (TPDC) through MEM, for further development of
            the gas and power sectors; and 3) to finance at Government
            of Tanzania's (GOT) request, the implementation of the
            option in the Songas power purchase agreement that allows
            GOT to reduce capacity charges arising out of and up to 75
            percent of costs associated with the engineering,
            procurement and construction of the Ubungo Expansion Project
            (UEP), by applying Output Based Aid (OBA) principles. The
            objectives of the Project, which have been largely met, are
            to: (i) develop the Borrower's natural gas reserves to
            produce least-cost power generation for domestic and
            industrial use in an environmentally sustainable and
            efficient manner; (ii) promote private sector ownership and
            management of the gas and power sectors; and (iii) encourage
            increased access of the poor to electricity supply by
            developing financially and institutionally sustainable rural
            power schemes to presently unserved areas along the corridor
            of the gas pipeline.

repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Songo Songo Gas Development
            & Power Generation Project : environmental impact assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Songo Songo Gas Development Project, which develops and
            markets natural gas resources in Tanzania. Key negative
            enviromental impacts and their mitigation measures follow.
            Project activities will be conducted to avoid affecting
            mammal species of conservation interest. Where the right of
            way passes through stretches of ntural vegetation, the
            project will minimize cutting of trees and offset tree
            cutting by supporting good forest management along the
            pipeline corridor. Areas prone to soil erosion will be
            stabilized after being disturbed. A solid waste management
            strategy will be implemented to ensure that waste is
            disposed of in an environmentally benign way. Air emissions
            will comply with World Bank guidelines. To respond to
            accidental gas releases, the project will develop and
            implement an emergency gas leak response plan. In the health
            area, a strategy for dealing with HIV/AIDS will be developed
            for the entire project.
